column1: swept to the long leg boundary. Goodbye gloom! Guptill's feet move nicely. Plants a big stride and sweeps this full ball from middle
length on middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket off the front foot
short of a length and turning in at leg stump. Stops as he gets back to the flick. Uppishly to deep midwicket's right
tossed right up at off stump and watchfully tapped into the covers
length on off stump, mistimed sweep straight to midwicket
length at off stump, hurries into the crease and punches to short extra

pandemonium! Amir has delivered first ball and the crowd has erupted. Full ball pushed across off stump. Guptill has played it onto his stumps. Did he expect it to swing back in? It didn't and by the end of this sequence, his hands are so far away from the body as he tries to drive through the off side. Amir wheels away into the leg side. What a start
short of a length and pushed across the corridor, left alone
beats the outside edge. Oooooh boy this is tense. Length on middle and off. Looks to defend close to the body but is caught inside the line by the angle
drops it into the covers with soft hands. Calm as. Length ball at off and he waits so long before getting bat on this
yorker at off stump. Nicely watched as he taps this back down the pitch
short of a length and angled in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
diving stop at midwicket. Shadab to his left stops a flick from middle stump
thick inside edge to backward square. Length on leg stump and he gets deep in the crease to flick
length on middle stump, flicked through short leg off the back foot
full on leg stump, leans in and flicks to deep square
in the air but safely out to long-off. No control at all on that drive. Feet cemented to the crease as this full ball lands outside off
length on middle stump, clipped watchfully to midwicket's right
chipped over midwicket and once again with little control. Munro's feet yet to wake up this innings. But this length ball on the pads wasn't going to trouble him at all
nicely timed. That's where he wants it - some room outside off, about thigh height. Stands tall and punches through the covers

slapped away! The counterpunch from Munro. That'll ease the nerves. It has certainly cut the noise. Three average deliveries from Amir. This is short of a length and even wider than the last one. Point has no chance
length ball slanted in at middle stump. Nicely behind the line to tap this to mid-on
short of a length in the corridor, pushed into the off side off the back foot
nice sound off the bat. Length ball angled in at off stump and firmly punched on the up to mid-off
yorker length just outside off, jammed into the covers
length and wide outside off, left alone
length on off stump, solidly defended off the back foot

caressed to the square leg boundary. A genius at work. Length on the pads, but stopping and climbing up on him a touch. But he adjusts after stretching out and gets the timing just right to keep both square leg and fine leg interested, before beating them both
length on off stump, defended into the off side
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball pushed down leg side, can't connect on the attempted flick. Amir thinks there might have been pad on it
well directed short ball. Slanting in towards the chest and Munro arches to let it go
length on leg stump, flicked out to deep square
short of a length in the corridor, soft hands, back foot defence towards gully
length ball pushed across the corridor, left alone
length at off stump, closes the face on this to get it to square leg
length and just outside off, 142 kph. Nicely forward to drive on the up to extra cover
taken! Haris holds on at first slip! Shaheen's extra bounce and Munro's casual swipe have resulted in the second wicket. Length and outside off, angled bat does him no good on this occasion
length and just outside off, punched confidently to mid-on
length and just outside off, 141kph, keeps the bat very close to body as he defends to mid-off
length outside off, mistimed drive to mid-off's right
length on leg stump, defended into the leg side from deep in the crease
gentle like a romcom heartthrob. Length ball just outside off, he gets a half stride in and barely swings his hands through this. Tapped wide of mid-off
all balance this time. Short of a length just outside off. Holds his shape so nicely as he springs forward and then moves the weight back to punch wide of point
short of a length and into the body. Shuffles and flicks to fine leg's left
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length and just outside the corridor. Covers off stump with the front foot as he lets this go
length and just outside off. Left alone
length outside off, flicked on the up to mid-on
full and just outside off, leans in and slices on the up to get this to point's right. Shadab chases pulls it in with a slide
length and just outside off, solidly defended off the back foot
length on off stump, gets back and dead-bats this pitch side on the off side. That ball was 140kph, but it barely gets to where short point might have been
length outside off, shuffles and punches it back to the bowler

he's held on to a blinder! Sarfraz with a gigantic leap to his right, one-handed! This is HUGE for Pakistan. This is the partnership they needed to break. Shaheen with that discipline again. Gets it a length in the corridor, gets the extra lift and Taylor's nervous forward prod has picked up an edge that flies towards first slip. Pakistan's captain doesn't let it get that far
full and just outside off, driven straight to extra cover
drifted full at leg stump, flicked to mid-on's right
through Sarfraz. Well, that's a hilarious follow up. Short of a length outside off, left alone, and Sarfraz is slow getting up
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
guided towards third man off the front foot. Length and just outside off, watches closely and gets it past slip
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
pitched up, Latham steps out and drives to cover
on a length, Latham shoulders arms
Latham isn't interested in playing at anything not threatening his stumps at the moment. Happy to let this one go by, too
good, probing line and length from Shaheen. On a length just outside the offstump line, and Latham defends.
let go once more
on a length, flicked to mid-wicket. Maiden over from Shaheen. The teenager suddenly has his mojo back
Hafeez starts off wicket-to-wicket, Williamson glances to midwicket
slightly shorter but spun in, and Williamson opens the face of the bat and guides to deep cover
Latham got stuck on the crease slightly. Tried to work Hafeez away to the onside, but ball struck his pads instead
good length. Testing Latham, who thought it best to block on the front foot
drops his length short. Latham drives to mid-on
excellent over. Finishes with another teasing line around off-stump. Latham looks solid enough in defence, but will need to get some runs to take some pressure off his captain
sharp single. Short ball, and Williamson keeps it down, and senses an opportunity for a run. Latham agianst Shaheen again. This should be fascinating
steps out and drives to mid-off. Middles it, but it's straight to the fielder.

gone, this is much too good for Latham. Shaheen's on fire. Pitched on a length just outside off stump, and shapes away ever so slightly, taking the outside edge of Latham's bat as he attempts yet another defensive stroke. Never quite looked like getting a move on, and now New Zealand are four down. It might really be on!
nearly nicked that one, too. Shaheen is unplayable at the moment. Pitched at that same nagging line once more, and whooshes past the outside edge
good leave. Shaheen is threatening that off-stump so regularly any leave is a brave one at the moment
slightly wider, and Neesham shoulders arms. one from the over, as well as a wicket. Pakistan surging, New Zealand slumping
flighted, and Kane drives it down to long-on
went with the line this time, and took a thick inside edge
not middled, but the inside edge goes to square leg along the ground
flight and turn, and deadbatted
this is accurate bowling from Hafeez. Just outside off stump and turning in. Williamson blocks
dragged down legside, and Williamson misses out. Got something on it, though, so no wide. Two from the over
tailing back in, driven down the ground
wide of off stump, and Neesham has no hesitation watching it go by
fuller, almost half-volley length. Neesham drives but finds the fielder at cover
gorgeous bowling. That offstump line plus the seam away from the left-hander is causing all sorts of problems for New Zealand. Neesham precariously close to nicking off
left alone
another maiden over. Shaheen's figures read 6-2-9-3. One of the bowling performances of the World Cup, this is shaping up to be.
tossed up, driven down to long-on
kept low and didn't turn, and nearly saw Neesham chop on. Goes down to fine leg and New Zealand sneak a couple
darting back in to Neesham, who defends
turned away to the on-side
stuck in the pitch somewhat, Williamson drives to a fielder
driven back to the bowler
low full toss, driven to mid-off. Shaheen in his seventh straight over now
back to that off stump line on a good length. Moves away and Neesham lets it go by
drops it and runs. Sharp single, and looked like Neesham wanted to get down the other end and let his captain deal with Shaheen while he's in this mood
shaping away from the right-hander, Williamson leaves
targets the stumps this time. Williamson defends through the offside
opens the face of the bat and helps it down to deep extra cover. Keeps the strike
fuller and tossed up, driven right back to Hafeez
gets it down to long-on this time
angled into the wickets, blocked
fended away to short cover

jabbed in the air from Neesham. This was a pressure release shot. Not sure it was really on. Didn't get to the pitch but the loft cleared mid-on, and the fielder scrambling back couldn't quite get to it in time
driven down the ground
down legside, but a bit of turn. Neesham turns it away to leg
Too full, and Neesham squeezes a single on the offside
sharp turn. Pitched outside off stump, though, and so Williamson untroubled by it as it spun away from him and into the keeper's gloves
cut away this time. He's getting spin but not quite hitting his lengths
that's better. neesham drives to the mid-on fielder
was that a googly to end up? I reckon it might have been. Neesham defended. Decent start
as he's done against Hafeez, he helps it down to long-on and turns the strike over
good delivery. Pulled his length back and let the ball dart into Neesham. Batsman steps away and just about keeps it out
turned down to long-on again. Such clear-headed batting by Williamson
good length. Hafeez not turning it much when he bowls to the leftie
and just as I say that, there's drift and turn. Pitches on off and spins away, beating Neesham, and almost Sarfaraz, all ends up
guides the last ball to deep cover. Keeps the strike, and for the next 10, Varun will take strike here
length on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
full outside off, driven to deep backward point
tossed up outside off, big stride as he defends to extra cover's left
full outside off, tapped to point's right off the front foot
short of  a length on leg stump, nudged to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length at middle, gets behind to make a lot of room to punch this past extra cover. The sweeper is very square so there's two in that
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
length and just outside off, gets behind the line and whips this into the empty midwicket region

inside edge! Oh so close. Length ball in the corridor and for the first time today, those feet don't get Williamson behind the line of the ball as he looks to punch through the off side. Narrowly misses off stump and is too much for Shaheen down at fine leg
past the outside edge. Slams it in at a length on off and KW is now wary of playing close to the body. So much so that he's inside the line of this
beats him again. Fuller than last ball, just a bit wider. Looks to defend on the front foot and is beaten on the angle
length on middle stump, glanced straight to square leg
length and ripping back in at leg stump. Nudges with the turn to long leg
lures him forward and gets him driving away from the body. Drift and dip outside off. Williamson not to the pitch as he drives with an open face to point
length outside off, defended to point on the front foot
short of a length outside off, punched to point's right off the back foot
full on leg stump, pushed into the midwicket region where Shadab has tumbled to stop it
short of a length and pushed across off stump, left alone
length ball, angled across the corridor, left alone
length on middle stump, tapped to mid-on's right off the back foot
get away. 140kph bouncer tailing in at an off stump line. Neesham drops the bat quickly to let it pass
length on off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot . 145kph
beaten. Short of a length at 144kph, in the corridor. Neesham wants to chop this square from inside the line. It blazes past him
short of a length outside off, a controlled punch past extra cover
full and just outside off, driven straight to extra cover
slider, back of a length on middle stump. Punched to midwicket off the back foot
full on middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
past the edge. Slider, short of a length and wide outside off. Looks to cut for the one that spins back in. It skids on with the angle
length at middle stump, steps out and hurriedly swipes to deep square leg
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper's right off the back foot
length at 140kph, just outside off. Defended on the back foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length outside off, punched on the up to sweeper's right
short of a length just outside off, rises on top of the bounce, deflects it down to third man
length ball wide outside off, left alone

run-out sent upstairs. Williamson at the striker's end. Is safe. Just a bit late letting go of that ball, was square leg and Williamson grounds the bat nicely to make his ground after Neesham flicks into the leg side

has he got him? He's got him! Shadab Khan has done it! Length ball, dipping outside off and drawing Williamson forward. he stabs at it away from the body as it turns and gets big off the surface. A faint edge on it and keeper holds on. Lovely bowling but also uncharacteristically loose from Williamson, who was getting a bit weary outside off in the last 15-20 minutes. Still, it takes some doing to get him out there and Shadab has produced the perfect delivery. Just a lovely pace on that
short of a length just outside off, looks to cut, chops it into the turf
short of a length just outside off, pushed down the pitch
length outside off, hard hands on the forward push. Out to sweeper cover
length and just outside off, tapped into the leg side
short of a length on leg stump, flicked down to fine leg
length in the corridor, defended to backward point on the front foot
big appeal from Sarfraz. Nothing from the bowler. It's for catch behind. Short of a length outside off. Jabs at it outside off. No review. And it is the right decision
length outside off, steered down to third man
bouncer at a leg stump line. Shapes to hook but there is no chance he's getting bat on that
beaten. Overpitched ball wide outside off, slashes at it and doesn't connect. Wahab smiles at the batsman. Perhaps in disbelief that this plan to get an expansive drive nearly worked at 86 for 5
full on middle stump, flicked down to long-on off the front foot
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's left
lbw appeal but there could be bat on that. Also a slider which could be going down leg. It's at a length and CDG has looked to pick it up behind square
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full at off stump from around the wicket. Flicked straight to midwicket
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
beaten. Length and pushed wide outside off. CDG has a swipe at it and doesn't connect
shot! Wonderful straight drive from CDG. This is length and just outside off. He brings a straight bat down on it and is rewarded for it. Sprints to the long-on boundary
past the edge. Angry stare from Wahab. Length in the corridor, defends inside the line

direct hit at the non-striker's end from Shadab, who was at point. Looks like CDG has JUST made it in. Wow this is close.Or has he? A flip on the angle and this is even closer...this is now about whether the umpire believes he's got the toe-end just behind the line. He thinks it has. Not out. That was sloppy of him to plonk the bat in like that. He'd poked this bouncer into the off side with soft hands. Shadab was down at it rapidly and throwing with barely any time to get himself balanced.
length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
short ball rising above the front shoulder. Ducks to let it go
flicked away to the onside
flight and turn, tempting de Grandhomme to go over the top. Drives it to mid-off instead, resisting the temptation
helped down to fine leg
ooh, nearly had him! This is what Shadab is trying to do. Luring CdG into an expansive drive over the top. The outside edge nearly carries to short third man
wider of off stump this time, and spinning away. CdG watches it past his bat
defended solidly this time. Intelligent over from Shadab. And on that note, here's drinks
angling into Neesham, who eases it to the legside for one
leg stump line to CdG, who looks like he's just about managing restraint
helped down to fine leg, where they pick up a couple
expansive drive, slightly uppish. Goes to long-on along the ground ultimately
poked to fine leg. They're happy with the singles for now
keeps the strike with that single. 6 from the over
tossed it up again, but CdG refuses to be tempted for now. Gets himself down the other end with a scampered single
Neesham isn't showing that restraint! The spin brings the ball back into him and he lifts it up over long-on. Goes all the way!
defended to square leg
wrong'un, and Neesham gets a thick outside edge to third man. Right, CdG to Shadab again
he went for it this time! Genuine edge was going to second slip, but Pakistan had just one. Races away to the boundary. NZ enjoying the rub of the green for now
absolutely magnificent. Pulled his length back and forced CdG on the back foot, but the sharp turn only just beat his outside edge. Good over from Shadab, but still goes for 12
shorter, helped down to long-on for one
no spin, wicket-to-wicket. Defended
Stuck in the pitch. Was in the air for a moment, prompting some excitement from behind the stumps
darting in. Neesham drives straight back
wider outside off and flighted. Poor delivery, and Neesham pounces on it. Drives it over extra cover for four, and Sarfaraz is frustrated
inside edge onto the pad from Neesham. Six off that over
short and pulled for six! is CdG coming to the party? Long hop, easy put away to cow corner
flighted this time, and a crunching drive finds the man at deep cover
helped to the offside deep fielder
Shadab continues to get turn, but CdG opens the face of the bat to get the ball to the point boundary, where the fielder can't prevent them coning back for two
defended
steps out and drives through the covers. NZ picking up the pace now. 35 off the past four
begins with an offcutter. Beats the beat of de Grandhomme and goes through on the bounce to Sarfaraz
rolls his fingers over that one. CdG gets some bat on it and third man has some mopping up to do
slower ball again, defended
short delivery and Neesham was on it in a flash. Cracked it through midwicket, what a sound that made off the bat!
ooh, alert from Neesham. Blocked it and found it potentially landing on the stumps. Got his bat in the way and guided the ball to safety
lifts it over the infield, no timing on that. Neesham was fooled by the change of pace and it went high in the air, but Shadab couldn't quite make up the ground . Amir isn't happy and NZ run two
driven to cover
87mph steaming past the batsman. Swing and a miss
slow and wide. Batsman gets an inside edge that goes through to the keeper on the bounce
tailing away from the right hander, who carves it through cover. The batsmen pondered two, but was never on in truth
into the body. Neesham defends to short point
short and Neesham couldn't quite get on top of that. Hung in the air for a while but well short of the deep fielder
helped down to third man
good delivery, coming into Neesham. Driven straight to mid-off
driven down the ground. These two are batting like the first 25 overs never happened
rolled his fingers over that again, and CdG deflects it to point
Defended, but nearly chopped onto the stumps. Tight over from Pakistan. They needed that. Can Amir finish it off well?
he can. Beat the bat and went through on the bounce. Two off the over
swing and a miss. 89mph that time. Neesham just struggling with Wahab's extra pace a little bit
blocked and run
wider off the crease, and a nasty bouncer. CdG gets out of the way, wisely
and the pace just proving too hot to handle for the batsmen. Late on the cut once more, and Sarfaraz is getting a touch frustrated. he wants that wicket, badly
well, that won't help his mood. CdG goes for the pull, and while he only gets a top edge, it loops over the keeper and trickles away for four
smart cricket. Prods this into the offside and keeps the strike. Good over from Wahab, but NZ still get six off it
starts off with a pearler. Slower ball that behaved like a left arm offbreak. Ripped away from CdG and nearly clipped off stump
and again. CdG steps out of his crease to deal with it, but this one pierces the gap between bat and pad
rolls his fingers over it. For the first time, CdG looks like he's happy to play it safe
works it through the legside. Neesham on strike, and he's one away from a half-century
gets it by running Shaheen down to third man. His sixth ODI half-century, and it was a grind at times. Absolutely vital for his country. Tehse aren't soft runs on placid tracks.
tails back in and a muffled appeal by Shaheen. Tidy over to begin his second spell
short of a length outside off, chopped to short third's right
full on leg stump, flicked to long-on, against the turn
short of a length slider at off stump, backs away and pulls hurriedly to midwicket
deceived in the air as he jumps out early. Ball keeps drifting away outside off and he is forced to stab into the covers
full on off stump, driven to long-off
full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
misfield by deep midwicket running to his right. Babar. Full ball on leg stump was jammed into the leg side and he couldn't pick it up after going for it one-handed
slower ball at a length outside off, punched on the rise to sweeper cover
length and just outside off. Guides it straight to point
lovely placed. Slower ball, full on leg stump. Allows that to land before flicking out at it and getting it wide of short fine
inside half of the bat as he looks to pump this through the off side. Slower ball again, at a length outside off. Single out at deep square
length at middle stump, tapped into the midwicket region with soft hands
slower ball at a length on off stump, defended watchfully into the off side
slower ball at a length on off stump. Defends to point's left off the front foot
slower ball, short of a length just outside off. Chopped straight to point
slower bouncer. Cut across the corridor and forces him to leave it
whack! Fifth slower ball in a row. But it's the width that has CDG extending his arms at this. It's at a length and he smacks through the line, uppishly and wide of mid-off
offcutter at a length on leg stump, deflected pitch side off the pad as he looks to flick
short at the chest, pulled firmly along the floor to deep square
full toss dipping in at off stump, punched hard back the ground but can't get it past the bowler's outstretched left hand

yorker just outside off, looks to carve this through off side and is beaten on the inside edge. Pakistan have the faint idea that there's an edge on that. They don't review. But the umpires now have a discussion and they've sent it up...so they think he's got an edge. Soft signal is not out. Sarfraz took this quite low. 'Can't use Ultra Edge,' says the third umpire presumably because the bat is jamming into the turf as the ball passes it. So it will remain not out, without even going to the zoomer on whether that carried. Hang on. Now they're checking again... this one is possibly Pakistan's review. Not clear yet. But it does remain not out. Funnily, this time Ultra Edge IS used. Don't let anyone tell you they understand cricket in its entirety...
short of a length at off stump, punched on the up to mid-off
length on off stump, punched on the rise to mid-off
inswinging yorker stabbed out to mid-off. That's the end of a wonderful spell
yorker at leg stump, pushed into the long-on region
full on middle stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
slower short ball outside off, pulls to deep square's left and he is rapid there, Imam. Keeps it to one
offcutter at a length outside off, run to point's left off the face to bring up his fifty. Top innings. And he has a few of these against Pakistan...
finds the deep backward square boundary. That is 100 runs between these two now. Low full toss drifting onto the pads and whipped away
beaten. Offcutter at a length outside off. Fishes at it from inside the line and is beaten
short of a length outside off, cut straight to backward point
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on middle stump, dropped in front of point with soft hands
slower ball, full and very wide outside off. Reaches out but it's too far away
yorker at middle stump, neatly tucked to deep midwicket's right with soft hands. Big boundary that side and they pick up two
low full toss on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right and this time the fielder is onto it much quicker
yorker tailing down leg side. Looks to flick and cops it on the pad. A run pitch side on the off side

sweeeeeeeet! Oh that sound off the bat. By now Neesham is waiting for an offcutter from Amir. It's all he's bowled the last few overs. He's waiting for it outside off, it lands at a length and he whips with the angle to clear deep midwicket
short of a length at middle stump, looks to pull, sliced uppishly towards long-on
full and very wide outside off, no reaching that
straight down the ground. Another offcutter from Amir. CDG waiting for it outside off. It's at a length, he waits on it and hammers it past his partner
full and wide outside off, looks to pummel this through the off side. Gets it off the toe-end to long-off
inswinging yorker. At off stump and he can't do more than poke this into the covers

smart! CDG knew where the fielders were. It was always going to be full from Amir and he waited deep in the crease. It also happened to be on leg stump so all he had to do was nudge this wide of short fine. Expertly done

dive but he can only parry it into the boundary to his right. Good effort from Fakhar running to his right at deep midwicket, but long-on was looking to help him out and won't be able to turn around and stop this. A good short too. Short ball at off stump and he pulled it right between those two fielders, off the front foot
full toss dipping in towards his body and he screams out as he manages to defend this. Well below waist height
nicely bowled. Slower short ball outside off. Looks to pull and is through it too quickly. Off the leading edge down to third man

this looks out. Run-out appeal sent upstairs. CDG walking off already. Guided a slower short ball to third man's left. Came back for a second that wasn't there. At least not for him. Sarfraz is in a poor position, right in front of the stumps, when he gathers this. But there's so much time to turn around, parry it onto the stumps and catch CDG short. A tame end to a very important innings
length at off stump, poked into the covers off the front foot
yorker dipping in at off stump. Jammed into the covers
yorker. Right up at leg stump and Neesham is forced to respect that. Just about keeps it out
full and swinging in at middle and off. Can't get enough room as he drives straight to long-off
length and into leg stump. Stands tall and uses the angle to get it to deep square's left. Big ground, easy two
full and into the toes. Flicked straight to fine leg
bouncer at a middle stump line. Ducks under it. It dips on Sarfaraz and bounces in front of him, and then off him into the off side
into the helmet as he's through the pull shot too early. A slower short ball. Loops up gently and gives him a kiss on the face. A run pitch side

makes room but can't get this wide of mid-off. It's a full toss and it's there for the shot he wants to play. But there is some very late inswing on this and he gets it off the inside part of the bat as a result
full toss, swung in again. Neesham goes with the direction of the movement. Mistimed slog along the floor to deep midwicket's right
full inswinger at middle stump, jammed back to the bowler

this is superb bowling. Followed by atrocious backing up by Wahab to give them an extra run. Inswinging yorker outside off, can do no more than slice it to sweeper cover. His throw comes in on the bounce and Wahab barely flaps out at it. Overthrows at midwicket
just wide. Full and wide outside off. He was backing into the leg side to make room and couldn't attempt a shot. It was just wide of the marker though
mistimed slug over mid-off. Plonks into the turf and rolls out weakly as long-on comes around. Length ball from Wahab but once again he escapes because of the late movement in
finally nails one! Wahab goes slower ball for some reason, and short. Sits up nicely for Neesham and he slaps from underneath to clear the midwicket boundary
good start. Movement in the air, pitched up, and only an inside edge saves a certain lbw
length delivery this time, and Imam turns it away to the onside
fuller. Boult wants to give this new ball achance to swing. Imam gets on the front foot nice and early this time, and makes good contact
short delivery, and that was nearly a run out! Imam ran it down to third man, but Guptill dived in the slips to prevent it going there, and nearly caught Imam napping
crisply timed to point. This is a good start by both batsman and bowler
brilliant shot. Picked up the short length early, and swivelled to the onside, dispatching the ball to the square leg boundary, First runs for Pakistan, they're off and running
full and wide. Not quite timed, but straight back to the bowler
loose delivery. Full and wide, and Henry just doesn't have the pace to get away with it. Fakhar caresses it through extra cover, and it races to the boundary
tighter to the stumps, and Fakhar can't get this one away
carved through extra cover, but doesn't quite have the timing on it to go all the way to the boundary
glorious batting. Pitched up to Imam, whose eyes light up at that length. Leans into that straight drive, and there's no stopping that speeding away
worked away to square leg. Good running; the pair come back for two. Excellent start by Pakistan
width from Boult, and Fakhar hasn't any patience for that line. Crunched through cover, and the ball smashes into the fence before the offside field even turn around to admire it
little risky from Fakhar. Turned his wrists against the swing and it nearly carried to Colin Munro at short midwicket. Boult won't mind seeing that
lovely delivery. Movement in the air but the ball held its line in the end, slicing Fakhar in half and barely missing off stump
driven right back to the bowler
good line and length. Pitched on middle stump and threatening off, but Fakhar keeps it out with the outer part of his bat. Good comeback from the bowler after the first ball

and caps the over with a wicket! Wasn't the best delivery, in truth. Dragged it down to the legside and didn't get the swing he was hoping. But Fakhar, who wanted to loft it over midwicket, found the leading edge and saw, with horror, the ball going to point instead, where Guptill's bucket-like hands sent him on his way
defended back to the bowler
on a length and going away from Imam, who allows it to do just that
Henry's keeping it simple. Stump to stump line. He hasn't found the swing that Boult has, so this is clever bowling
driven to mid-off and the pair steal a single. Good running. First look at Babar now
good start. Off sump line, forcing Babar to dead-bat it
down legside slightly, Babar defends
shaping away. Imam gets onto the front foot and drives to extra cover
probing delivery, gets the outside edge. NZ don't have second slip, and Boult watches in agony as that one runs down to third man for four. NZ must attack, especially with Boult moving it about
straighter on this occasion, and Imam blocks stoutly

short ball, where has that gone? Turns out it hit Imam and snuggled into his pad. Imam asks the fielders if it's okay to take it out with his hand. NZ aren't going to appeal, of course, so no harm done
short and fast. Pushes Imam back who fends it away to the leg side
Boult continuing to pitch it up. Another good over. Exciting start, this
driven through the offside, but can't beat the man stationed at mid-off
gets on the back foot and punches it through the offside. After a loose first over, Henry is supporting Boult really well

and NZ might just have had another wicket! Short delivery, and Babar ran out of patience, skying an attempted pull. Colin de Grandhomme raced back and was just a yard away from completing a remarkable catch
better shot. This is what he should do. Slices this through the offside field, and gets himself off strike with three
punched down the ground and Pakistan scamper through for a quick single
too close to cut, which is why Babar doesn't quite get the timing. Six off a very eventful over
shaping away, but Imam steps into the off-drive and just about splits the cover fielders. good cricket from the left-hander.
straighter ball, defended to the onside
blocked into the offside
kept slightly low, but Imam was equal to it, and drives it back to the bowler
pitched up again and Imam defends through the offside
excellent over from Boult. two off that one
Henry keeping his lengths tight. Babar tried to cut again, but no real timing
pitched up for once. Babar drives to extra cover. Struggling to get it away for now. Needs to remain patient
wicket-to-wicket, Babar offers a defensive stroke
driven on the up, but Neesham ensures Santner's slight misfield won't yield any runs
angled to point, where the fielder closes in sharply
pulled to square leg, ensuring this won't be a maiden. NZ have pulled things back nicely since that Fakhar wicket
absolute jaffa, that one. Babar closed the face of the bat but the ball moved at the last moment. Just missed the off stump, the outside edge, as well as the pad. Boult gets one over Babar
and Babar gets his own back! Full and wide and Babar latches onto it in a flash, carving the point and cover-point fielders
fantastic battle, this. Boult pulls the length back and beats Babar's outside edge. Absorbing stuff
wisely, Babar shoulders arms. Boult is a threat Babar wants to negate as much as possible. No point fighting fire with fire just yet
excellent shot. Boult came around the wicket to angle it in, but this was much too straight for Babra to miss out. Leans into the classical drive, and Boult lets out a cry of anguish
back over the wicket, and Babar blocks to close out the over. Round one Babar, I'd say
Henry continues his fifth over, and Imam drives to extra cover, only to find the fielder
uppish, got Imam's leading edge. But far enough away from Henry
worked away to fine leg. Batsmen think about two, but never on
Babar lets it go. The pair beginning to settle now
came back into the batsman, but a thick inside edge keeps it out
tucked away to mid-on. Quick single, and the Powerplay's done. To take you trough the next ten, here's Varun
short of a length just outside off, on the back foot and sliced to third man

Guptill you absolute monster! Big strides forward, big limbs reaching out, but the grace of a much smaller man as he dives and gets his fingers under this at point! And this following an absolute scorcher of a bouncer from Lockie, jumping up at Imam's grille from middle stump. Remember, he'd caused him problems in the UAE, even hit him on the head not so long ago. Goes straight for the bouncer option. Imam just fends at it with no clue and it pings off the shoulder of the bat. Just brutal fast bowling

Hafeez nearly runs himself out of the contest! Geez. Pakistan's most experienced batsman, looked like a newbiew there. Length and in at off stump. His feet are rooted and he pokes at this nervously. It rolls into the leg side weakly and he's just taken off without a call. Neesham can't hit direct
onto his glove. Short bal lrising into the corridor. Hangs the bat out and hopes. It's into his body. And then a sheepish grin
beats the inside edge. Short of a length and angled in. He cuts from over it
inside edge again as he takes the bottom hand off and hangs the bat out to protect his mid-riff. This short ball gives him no room. It flies down to fine leg
length ball outside off, driven on the rise to sort extra
full on middle stump, flicked straight to square leg
length on off stump, has him hopping as he defends into the off side
length on middle stump, deep in the crease as he taps this to mid-on
aerial but not enough on this to carry to the bowler. Full and driving length, but he gets tangled by his own forward stride and ends up hitting more of his pad than the ball
length on middle stump, flicked to deep square's left
past the outside edge. 146kph, length and angled in at off stump. Then it straigthens off the surface as he looks to defend this with half a stride
shot! Short ball stays about hip height and Hafeez gets on his back toe, swivels, and launches this to the square leg boundary. Classy
beaten. Hangs inside the line again, bigger stride, but not any closer to nailing the forward defence
length and in at off stump, defended down the pitch off the inside half
past the outside edge again. 146kph length ball, both straightens and jumps past his forward defence
length outside off, dabs it down to third man with an open face
full and outside off. Leans in to drive to extra cover
length and in the corridor, blocked on the front foot
inside half of the bat as he leans in fishes at this on off stump. Trickles out to deep square
length and in at middle stump, defended off the back foot
slapped away but sweeper cover is there to cut that off to his right. Length ball, hooping away outside off. Flat-batted on the front foot
across the line but effective in the end. Shuffles and flicks this length ball to fine leg's left from off stump
beaten. At the moment, Hafeez is the U-15 starlet playing his first U-23 match. Not able to figure out a way against this back of a length delivery Lockie keeps getting in the corridor
but he's figured this out! Glorious weight transfer to get on top. In the corridor, a tad shorter than before but he makes enough room and opens the face to get it past point
yorker from wide of the crease and he manages to keep the front leg leg side of it to jam it out

oh beautiful. Another short ball at waist height. Not too different in line from the one he punched through point, but this time he's swiveled and used the angle to find the long leg boundary. Rolls the wrists on it to keep it down

bouncer hits him on the grille. 142kph. Ferguson's had enough of the short ball that doesn't rise up. This is banged in, a proper bouncer. And Hafeez is swiping hopefully from under it. Flush in the grille. He's on his feet though
short of a length just outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
deftly deflected to third man's left for two. Short of a length in the corridor, waits for it to come on and runs it off the surface, very very late
overpitched on middle stump, whipped out to deep square
length on the front foot, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket off the front foot
length and just outside off, opens the face as he defends to point
smash. Short and wide at 117kph and he will not miss out. Gets the weight on the back foot and chops it past point
oh, so elegant. Length ball just outside off and he seems to have enough time to get forward to this and open the face at just the right moment. On the up, flies past point
short and in the corridor, gets leg side of it and dabs it past slip
full outside off, looks to drive but doesn't get enough weight into the forward press. This rolls out to mid-on
past the edge. Again. he keeps straightening the incoming ball to beat Hafeez's outside edge. At 147kph
short and very wide. Called for the height and the crowd erupts
outside edge falls short of Taylor at slip! Oh Lockie must be seething right now. Hafeez has managed to get bat on one, another one that has straigthened, but there's no luck for him still
length and in at off stump, tapped to cover off the back foot
what a start. Santner with the drift in towards off stump, the dip to land well in front of Babar's big stride, and the turn to beat the bat
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover's right. Dive and parried to long-off
short outside off, steered into the point region off the back foot
length on leg stump, tucked into the leg side
beaten again. Santner is doing nicely here. Luring him in with plenty of flight. This one is wider. He looks to drive on the up
squared him up with big turn from a middle stump line. Babar circumspect as he gets deep in the crease and closes the face on this. Leading edge goes past slip
overpitched just outside off, driven back to the bowler on the bounce
short and wide outside off, classy back foot punch, but straight to point
length and in at the corridor, solidly blocked on the front foot
beaten. Loose from Babar. Short of a length outside off and he has a stab at it outside off to try and get it to third man
leading edge trickles past the bowler. Slight mix-up as mid-on gets down at this, but he says no in time. Short of a length on leg, closes the face too early on the flick

oh yes. More of that, sir. Short and up in the corridor and he plays just about the perfect square drive. Right on top of it, contact right under his eyes, elbow nice and high and the bat face not opened till it was required. Blazes to point's left

short and turning away outside off. Follows with his hands and gets this to sweeper's left. A poor throw from there, both in terms of delivery and choice. Babar was rooted as Hafeez came running back. Throw went to the keeper, which was probably the wrong option
full on middle stump, pushes with hard hands and gets it down the pitch
under-edge drops into the turf, next to off stump. Short ball doesn't turn as much as he looks to cut
big turn. Pitching middle and leg, and rising sharply past the attempted defence on the back foot
length and skidding through outside off. Blocked on the front foot
tosses it up wide outside off, looks for the cut but withdraws in the end
turned away to square leg
short and slightly wide of off stump Hafeez lets it go
defend to the onside
dragged down leg side, and Hafeez works it away to turn the strike over
short. Babar is onto the length but doesn't get the timing on his pull shot
flicked away nicely. Two is pondered, but decided against in the end
flighted. Babar blocks
that's the line. Just fuller than good length and that's where Santner is getting his prodigious turn. Babar runs it down to third man, but wasn't quite in control
jaffa. Pitched on middle and leg and turned away. Babar had no answer, and did well to miss it in the end
pads up to that one
was that a drop? I think it might have been! How costly will that be?
defended to cover. Could have been a massively successful over, that
wide, and Hafeez cut it away firmly. Went through Guptill's hands on the bounce, bucket-like though they may be
run down to third man, gets it quite fine, and only sharp work at the boundary saves two runs
driven on the full, but straight to a fielder
dragged down legside. Every run matters for Pakistan. And for NZ, for that matter
Neesham isn't quick enough to bowl that length. Short of a length, but sat up for Babar and begged to be spanked. Babar is too good not to oblige, and bludgeons it to he midwicket boundary
angled through the offside
edged, and that races down to third man. Good over this has been for Pakistan! 13 off it. This partnership beginning to turn the tide for Pakistan
cut through the offside
defended back to the bowler
bowling a nice off stump line. Blocked
glanced, but didn't have the timing to take a single that Hafeez was quite keen for
this time he can. Stylish shot to deep extra, and now Santner is Hafeez's problem
blocked to point
full, and dug away to point for one
gets it past short third. Took a fantastic effort on the boundary from Colin Munro to prevent four, but the pair get three
sloppy from the man at cover. NZ need to tighten up
attempted reverse sweep, Hafeez gets nowhere near it

and that's the most Hafeez way to get out! The man who holed out to Aaron Finch and lost his wicket to Aiden Markram now charges down the pitch to Williamson, and smashes it right down cow corner's throat. In the xact spot he gave it away against Australia
full toss, straight to mid-on. What a move by the New Zealand captain!
middle stump line, no spin this time. Babar blocks
he top-edged this and Munro looked in business for a while. In the air a long time but just bounces a few yards out. Pakistan fans had their hearts in their mouths there
turned back in. Inside edge. Excitement for NZ
uses his feet and guides it away to long-on. Big cheer from the Pakistan fans. They sense the importance of this passage of play
defended
driven back to the bowler
dragged it short, did Williamson, and allows Haris Sohail to get it away and turn the strike over
gets his line wrong and Babar whips it away to fine leg. Brings up his half-century. Needs this to become a hundred.
sliced away through the cover region. Williamson hasn't quite been on the money this over
better. Steps out and blocks
swept away, but excellent work from Taylor at square leg ensures it's a dot ball
spins back in and pops up off the pad. The keeper reckons there might have been an edge, but can't complete the catch in time anyway
were there two noises. Ripped back into Haris off the rough and cannons off the pad into Taylor. Big appeal, but umpire unmoved
sharp turn once more, and blocked
was that out? Haris races down the wicket, and comes off his pad and goes through to Taylor. NZ sounded more confident this time, but the umpire disagrees
turned away to the onside.
snorts back in, and Haris just keeps it out. How Santner hasn't taken a wicket I don't know
flatter on this occasion, allowing Haris to glance to the onside for one. Can consider himself very lucky to escape unscathed
driven back
good shot. Opens the face of the bat and scythes it past the man at 45, and sees it race down to the boundary. Williamson is easier to play for Haris, with the ball going away
ripper. Turns Beats off stump, as well as the outside edge. This is the line
poor from Haris. Looks to drive on the up. Risky option, and lucky it doesn't take the edge
low full toss. Diving stop from Guptill at extra cover saves a run
absolutely unplayable. Williamson is turning it around corners, too. I reckon that pitched on middle and Latham took it about a third of the way to the wide marker
thick outside edge, but he's kept it down
defended solidly
held its line for once, and Babar got an inside edge. Sprints off strike
finally some aggression. Haris races down the track, and gets to the pitch off the ball, and deposits it into the stand behind midwicket. The pressure release is like the pop of a balloon
tucked to square leg. Excellent over for Pakistan for once
defended. Whew, that was fun. Varun takes you through the next 10
short of a length outside off, slices to short third man
length ball down leg side, can't get bat to it
length outside off, pushed into the off side off the front foot
beats the outside edge. Tossed up outside off, draws him in, spins it past the edge
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
beaten. Straighter ball, short and wide. Cuts for the turn and is deceived

sent back. Full ball on leg stump, flicks to deep square's right and is very keen because that's a big gaping area. Wants the second run but his partner says gaadi ko chalana babu zara halke halke halke
overpitched on middle stump, driven firmly back at the bowler
short and well down leg side. Can't connect on it
beaten. Palm to face. Lockie has gone past the outside edge so many times. This one is pure angle. Length ball across Haris and looks to play into the leg side
length ball just outside off, firmly punched to extra cover's left. He dives but parries it to mid-off's left
short of a length on middle stump, mistimed pull ends up a stroke of genius. Trickles to deep square's left and he can come back for the second
length ball, 146kph at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
full and just outside off, gorgeous drive on the front foot but can't beat extra cover's dive to the right
length on middle stump, nudged through square leg off the back foot
full outside off, leans in and flicks to midwicket
length at leg stump, shuffles and sweeps to find long leg
length on off stump, defended with the turn into the off side
full outside off, sliced to point's left
full outside off, flicked to midwicket's right
short of a length outside off, sliced to third man's left
crunched. But only one. Full outside off and he chops down on this to get it to sweeper's left
short of a length outside off, punched to point off the back foot
short of a length outside off, opens the face and gets it down to third man
bouncer. Sways out of the way. Middle stump line and he sways into the leg side
length and in at leg stump. Looks to flick but this thuds the front pad
beaten in flight after stepping out, but manages to defend into the off side
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts to long-off
short at middle stump, pulled to square leg
length outside off, leans in, flicks to long-on
short and wide outside off, punched firmly but straight to extra cover
short of a length outside off, backs away and whips to mid-on's left
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep square
in the air but safely between mid-off and extra cover! That was a tense moment when he hit it. Lobbed up at a length wide outside off, he really throws his hands at this. Quite safely in the end
short of a length outside off, dabs it to short third's left
length on middle and some shape back in. Driven on the rise to long-on
short and curving away wide outside off. Left alone
length outside off, leans in and drives it back to the bowler on the up
full outside off, flowing cover drive out to the sweeper
dropped short outside off, pulled straight to midwicket

oh gorgeous! What an unbelievable shot. Length ball tossed up outside off and he's hit him over mid-off, against the turn. Against some big turn. Only possible if your footwork is perfect. And his was. Held the shape too, offering the full face of the bat
whack! Is this it? That one over too many from a part-timer? It's dropped short at leg stump and he feasts on this. Pulled to the square leg boundary
full on leg stump, clipped into the leg side with soft hands
short and wide outside off, backs away and slaps to long-off
length outside off, defended into the off side off the front foot
short of a length outside off, turned into the leg side off the back foot
slower ball at a length outside off, from around the wicket. No grip on it. He tucks it to fine leg with the angle
short of a length outside off, punched on the rise to cover

drilled! Haris picks the full ball outside off, gets his back leg off the pitch as he connects and finishes the full swing to get it over Boult's head. Flat and just clears the boundary. Might have been a slower ball, but it doesn't matter
length on off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
short and wide outside off, shapes to pull, lets it pass
length on leg stump, shoveled straight to short fine
short and in at leg stump, pulled to deep backward square
short of a length outside off, tucked into the leg side off the back foot
length on middle stump, flicks off the inside half to deep square

shot! Sublime from Haris. Just world class. This is tossed up outside off, very slow. Grips a shade as he gets forward but he's managed to extend the arms and place this drive past extra cover. It's not an easy shot on this pitch, even with the turn. The timing had to be perfect
full on off stump, driven with the turn down to long-off
length outside off, flicked straight to backward square leg
length ball pitches off stump, turns sharply down leg side. Stumping appeal turned down and, interestingly, not called wide. He had shuffled to try and flick
short of a length and in at off stump, backs away and punches to sweeper cover
misfield Guptill at extra cover. Full on off stump, harmlessly driven to extra cover and no run turns to two. He had the barrier and all, but this goes through
length at off stump, punched to extra cover where Guptill is on the floor to stop this
short and a bit of width. Sliced clear of point and Matt Henry does well to cut it off
blocked, nearly chopped on by Babar. Boult bowling a little short
that's full but wide. Half-volley length, really. He's lucky Babar doesn't make him pay
bouncer that Babar guides down to midwicket. That's all Pakistan need. No heroics, no fireworks
angled to point
gorgeous touch from Haris. Just opened the face of the bat and got it sooo fine. Absolutely raced away, and third man had no chance. Six of what was shaping up to be a tight over
short boundary towards midwicket, and Babar slog sweeps it right there. Didn't care about how much it might spin, just hit across the line and got it right in the middle of the bat
Copy and paste! Copy and paste! Exactly the same delivery, and if possible, an even more commanding shot. The same spot
and prods to short third man and scuttles down to the other end. Santner is being seen off, and somehow, he's wicketless
helped to the offside. Pakistan are, would you believe it, being sensible. SENSIBLE!!
slashed away to deep extra cover. the 200 is up, and Babar is 11 short of his 10th hundred
glanced away for one. Excellent over for Pakistan
stump-to-stump, defended right back
whipped odwn to square leg. Right, New Zealand need to break through now. 2.4 overs of Boult and one from Santner left. I reckon we see Lockie soon now, too
too full and wide from Boult and stroked away to extra cover. Brilliant work from Colin Munro on the boundary to save four. Boult not quite hitting his lengths here
cutter. Babar wanted to slash this through extra cover but no timing on it
better from Boult, blocked by Babar
wild flash from Babar. He wants a wide there, but umpire unmoved. Pakistan 34 away now, and in truth, doing this at a canter
sharp turn, but Haris fends him off
and again. Intelligently played, tucking it into a gap and turning the strike over
good line. Defended
dragged it down and Babar muscles it through the onside and race back for two
turn and bounce. Babar blocks
driven back
lovely delivery. Haris wanted to run him down to third man again, but almost took his edge instead
and again. Just beats the edge again. Good battle, this, and a key, key over
gets his cut away this time. Stops the boundary but Haris brings up his second consecutive half-century. Where was he all this while? Oh, warming the bench. How classically Pakistani

whipped away to the onside, and that brings up the 100-partnership. How crucial has this been for Pakistan, and how unlikely it looked when Santner weaved his magic in his first spell. The two most in-form batsmen for Pakistan look like they're guiding them home, keeping them alive
bouncer but doesn't quite have the fizz on it. Haris chooses not to bother with it

magnificent. The confidence oozing through his veins. Drives Boult on the up through extra cover, as if people should do this to Boult all the time. Trickles down for four, and the fight is seeping out of New Zealand at last
slower delivery. Beats Babar's attempt to guide it to third man
wide yorker, and this time he does get it to third man
nails the yorker, but Haris digs it out and scampers through. Babar six away from a hundred
short ball, upper-cut to third man. It's almost eerie how drama-free this chase suddenly is. This is the moment Pakistan tend to self-destruct
another bouncer. Given a wide
took his eyes off that bouncer, but still managed to get it in the middle of the blade.
spectacular. Princely! Babar pulls to cow corner and the ball absolutely gallops to the rope for four. Pakistan's MVP is on 99
off stump line, Haris offers a straight bat
pulled to fine leg, and this is the moment. Babar on 99, Babar on strike
eyes lit up, but the cut shot didn't have the placement
excellent delivery, just seamed away  and evaded Babar's drive. The crowd gasps. They're expectant, but also tense
getting excited, was Babar. Looked to use his wrists and nudge it down to fine leg, but got a leading edge. Needs to keep his focus
straight to the fielder at cover-point. Babar will have to wait another over, at least. Good over from Boult, who is also bowled out. Began with much promise, but couldn't quite follow it up
beautifully played. This is a 90mph bowler, but Haris had so much time. Opened the face of the bat and played it right under his nose, and sliced it through the backward point/third man gap
driven to mid-off, and they change ends. Babar on strike again, and the crowd falls silent in nervous excitement

and here it is! The 10th hundred for Babar Azam, and perhaps his most precious. Short and wide, and Babar slashes it away to deep cover before embracing Haris. The crowd goes wild, and every cheer is well deserved. The look on his face tells you how much it meant
good bouncer, Top edged into Haris's grill. No harm done, though, he's fine
quick bouncer, but Bruce Oxenford reckons it's too high. Wide called, and Pakistan one hit away.
full toss that Haris times nicely over extra cover. Another two, and now a boundary will do it. Will it come off this delivery?
slower ball deceived him. Still four to go
smeared through the onside. They're doing this in singles now
helped down to fine leg
is that gone? The third umpire is involved! Slower ball that Babar deadbatted but Haris absolutely hared through for one. He's short of his ground! Haris falls for a well-made 68
Sarfaraz jabbed it through backward point and wanted a single, but Babar sends him back
comes through for one that time. Tucked into the on-side, and the scores are level
straight to mid-on. Babar will not hit the winning runs, it seems. We're going to the final six balls
full toss, and Sarfaraz smashes it through point. Massive win for Pakistan!
